verses.verse: How doth the <S%H5892>city<s%> <S%H3427>sit<s%> <S%H910>solitary<s%>, that was <S%H7227>full<s%> of <S%H5971>people<s%>! how is she become as a <S%H490>widow<s%>! she that was <S%H7227>great<s%> among the <S%H1471>nations<s%>, and <S%H8282>princess<s%> among the <S%H4082>provinces<s%>, how is she become <S%H4522>tributary<s%>!

She <S%H1058>weepeth<s%> <S%H1058>sore<s%> in the <S%H3915>night<s%>, and her <S%H1832>tears<s%> are on her <S%H3895>cheeks<s%>: among all her <S%H157>lovers<s%> she hath none to <S%H5162>comfort<s%> her: all her <S%H7453>friends<s%> have dealt <S%H898>treacherously<s%> with her, they are become her <S%H341>enemies<s%>.

<S%H3063>Judah<s%> is gone into <S%H1540>captivity<s%> because of <S%H6040>affliction<s%>, and because of <S%H7230>great<s%> <S%H5656>servitude<s%>: she <S%H3427>dwelleth<s%> among the <S%H1471>heathen<s%>, she <S%H4672>findeth<s%> no <S%H4494>rest<s%>: all her <S%H7291>persecutors<s%> <S%H5381>overtook<s%> her between the <S%H4712>straits<s%>. because of great: Heb. for the greatness of servitude

The <S%H1870>ways<s%> of <S%H6726>Zion<s%> do <S%H57>mourn<s%>, because none <S%H935>come<s%> to the solemn <S%H4150>feasts<s%>: all her <S%H8179>gates<s%> are <S%H8074>desolate<s%>: her <S%H3548>priests<s%> <S%H584>sigh<s%>, her <S%H1330>virgins<s%> are <S%H3013>afflicted<s%>, and she is in <S%H4843>bitterness<s%>.

Her <S%H6862>adversaries<s%> are the <S%H7218>chief<s%>, her <S%H341>enemies<s%> <S%H7951>prosper<s%>; for the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> hath <S%H3013>afflicted<s%> her for the <S%H7230>multitude<s%> of her <S%H6588>transgressions<s%>: her <S%H5768>children<s%> are <S%H1980>gone<s%> into <S%H7628>captivity<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> the <S%H6862>enemy<s%>.

And from the <S%H1323>daughter<s%> of <S%H6726>Zion<s%> all her <S%H1926>beauty<s%> is <S%H3318>departed<s%>: her <S%H8269>princes<s%> are become like <S%H354>harts<s%> that <S%H4672>find<s%> no <S%H4829>pasture<s%>, and they are <S%H3212>gone<s%> without <S%H3581>strength<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> the <S%H7291>pursuer<s%>.

<S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%> <S%H2142>remembered<s%> in the <S%H3117>days<s%> of her <S%H6040>affliction<s%> and of her <S%H4788>miseries<s%> all her pleasant <S%H4262>things<s%> that she had in the <S%H3117>days<s%> of <S%H6924>old<s%>, when her <S%H5971>people<s%> <S%H5307>fell<s%> into the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of the <S%H6862>enemy<s%>, and none did <S%H5826>help<s%> her: the <S%H6862>adversaries<s%> <S%H7200>saw<s%> her, and did <S%H7832>mock<s%> at her <S%H4868>sabbaths<s%>. pleasant: or, desirable

<S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%> hath <S%H2399>grievously<s%> <S%H2398>sinned<s%>; therefore she is <S%H5206>removed<s%>: all that <S%H3513>honoured<s%> her <S%H2107>despise<s%> her, because they have <S%H7200>seen<s%> her <S%H6172>nakedness<s%>: yea, she <S%H584>sigheth<s%>, and <S%H7725>turneth<s%> <S%H268>backward<s%>. is: Heb. is become a removing, or, wandering

Her <S%H2932>filthiness<s%> is in her <S%H7757>skirts<s%>; she <S%H2142>remembereth<s%> not her last <S%H319>end<s%>; therefore she came <S%H3381>down<s%> <S%H6382>wonderfully<s%>: she had no <S%H5162>comforter<s%>. O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, <S%H7200>behold<s%> my <S%H6040>affliction<s%>: for the <S%H341>enemy<s%> hath <S%H1431>magnified<s%> himself.

The <S%H6862>adversary<s%> hath spread <S%H6566>out<s%> his <S%H3027>hand<s%> upon all her pleasant <S%H4261>things<s%>: for she hath <S%H7200>seen<s%> that the <S%H1471>heathen<s%> <S%H935>entered<s%> into her <S%H4720>sanctuary<s%>, whom thou didst <S%H6680>command<s%> that they should not <S%H935>enter<s%> into thy <S%H6951>congregation<s%>. pleasant: or, desirable

All her <S%H5971>people<s%> <S%H584>sigh<s%>, they <S%H1245>seek<s%> <S%H3899>bread<s%>; they have <S%H5414>given<s%> their pleasant <S%H4261>things<s%> <S%H4262><s%> for <S%H400>meat<s%> to <S%H7725>relieve<s%> the <S%H5315>soul<s%>: <S%H7200>see<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, and <S%H5027>consider<s%>; for I am become <S%H2151>vile<s%>. to: or, to make the soul to come again

Is it nothing to you, all ye that <S%H5674>pass<s%> <S%H1870>by<s%>? <S%H5027>behold<s%>, and <S%H7200>see<s%> if there <S%H3426>be<s%> any <S%H4341>sorrow<s%> like unto my <S%H4341>sorrow<s%>, which is <S%H5953>done<s%> unto me, wherewith the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> hath <S%H3013>afflicted<s%> me in the <S%H3117>day<s%> of his <S%H2740>fierce<s%> <S%H639>anger<s%>. Is it: or, It is nothing pass by: Heb. pass by the way?

From <S%H4791>above<s%> hath he <S%H7971>sent<s%> <S%H784>fire<s%> into my <S%H6106>bones<s%>, and it <S%H7287>prevaileth<s%> against them: he hath <S%H6566>spread<s%> a <S%H7568>net<s%> for my <S%H7272>feet<s%>, he hath <S%H7725>turned<s%> me <S%H268>back<s%>: he hath <S%H5414>made<s%> me <S%H8074>desolate<s%> and <S%H1739>faint<s%> all the <S%H3117>day<s%>.

The <S%H5923>yoke<s%> of my <S%H6588>transgressions<s%> is <S%H8244>bound<s%> by his <S%H3027>hand<s%>: they are <S%H8276>wreathed<s%>, and come <S%H5927>up<s%> upon my <S%H6677>neck<s%>: he hath made my <S%H3581>strength<s%> to <S%H3782>fall<s%>, the <S%H136>Lord<s%> hath <S%H5414>delivered<s%> me into their <S%H3027>hands<s%>, from whom I am not <S%H3201>able<s%> to rise <S%H6965>up<s%>.

The <S%H136>Lord<s%> hath trodden under <S%H5541>foot<s%> all my <S%H47>mighty<s%> men in the <S%H7130>midst<s%> of me: he hath <S%H7121>called<s%> an <S%H4150>assembly<s%> against me to <S%H7665>crush<s%> my young <S%H970>men<s%>: the <S%H136>Lord<s%> hath <S%H1869>trodden<s%> the <S%H1330>virgin<s%>, the <S%H1323>daughter<s%> of <S%H3063>Judah<s%>, as in a <S%H1660>winepress<s%>. the virgin: or, the winepress of the virgin, etc

For these things I <S%H1058>weep<s%>; mine <S%H5869>eye<s%>, mine <S%H5869>eye<s%> runneth <S%H3381>down<s%> with <S%H4325>water<s%>, because the <S%H5162>comforter<s%> that should <S%H7725>relieve<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%> is <S%H7368>far<s%> from me: my <S%H1121>children<s%> are <S%H8074>desolate<s%>, because the <S%H341>enemy<s%> <S%H1396>prevailed<s%>. relieve: Heb. bring back

<S%H6726>Zion<s%> spreadeth <S%H6566>forth<s%> her <S%H3027>hands<s%>, and there is none to <S%H5162>comfort<s%> her: the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> hath <S%H6680>commanded<s%> concerning <S%H3290>Jacob<s%>, that his <S%H6862>adversaries<s%> should be round <S%H5439>about<s%> him: <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%> is as a menstruous <S%H5079>woman<s%> among them.

The <S%H3068>LORD<s%> is <S%H6662>righteous<s%>; for I have <S%H4784>rebelled<s%> against his <S%H6310>commandment<s%>: <S%H8085>hear<s%>, I pray you, all <S%H5971>people<s%>, and <S%H7200>behold<s%> my <S%H4341>sorrow<s%>: my <S%H1330>virgins<s%> and my young <S%H970>men<s%> are <S%H1980>gone<s%> into <S%H7628>captivity<s%>. commandment: Heb. mouth

I <S%H7121>called<s%> for my <S%H157>lovers<s%>, but they <S%H7411>deceived<s%> me: my <S%H3548>priests<s%> and mine <S%H2205>elders<s%> gave up the <S%H1478>ghost<s%> in the <S%H5892>city<s%>, while they <S%H1245>sought<s%> their <S%H400>meat<s%> to <S%H7725>relieve<s%> their <S%H5315>souls<s%>.

<S%H7200>Behold<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>; for I am in <S%H6887>distress<s%>: my <S%H4578>bowels<s%> are <S%H2560>troubled<s%>; mine <S%H3820>heart<s%> is <S%H2015>turned<s%> <S%H7130>within<s%> me; for I have <S%H4784>grievously<s%> <S%H4784>rebelled<s%>: <S%H2351>abroad<s%> the <S%H2719>sword<s%> <S%H7921>bereaveth<s%>, at <S%H1004>home<s%> there is as <S%H4194>death<s%>.

They have <S%H8085>heard<s%> that I <S%H584>sigh<s%>: there is none to <S%H5162>comfort<s%> me: all mine <S%H341>enemies<s%> have <S%H8085>heard<s%> of my <S%H7451>trouble<s%>; they are <S%H7797>glad<s%> that thou hast <S%H6213>done<s%> it: thou wilt <S%H935>bring<s%> the <S%H3117>day<s%> that thou hast <S%H7121>called<s%>, and they shall be <S%H3644>like<s%> unto me. called: or, proclaimed

Let all their <S%H7451>wickedness<s%> <S%H935>come<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> thee; and <S%H5953>do<s%> unto them, as thou hast <S%H5953>done<s%> unto me for all my <S%H6588>transgressions<s%>: for my <S%H585>sighs<s%> are <S%H7227>many<s%>, and my <S%H3820>heart<s%> is <S%H1742>faint<s%>.
